ISSUE.TITLE: Logging in should revoke existing token if any
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: If we're logging out to log in under a different account, we should revoke the existing token.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Options is a sub section of usage

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fix now alias on new domains Bail if no records are found for a domain to allow adding the records. now alias derp domain.com -d > [debug] Checking for updates. > [debug] Up to date (1.0.0). > [debug] /list: 583.880ms > [debug] matched deployment derp by url derp.now.sh > domain.com is a custom domain. > Verifying the DNS settings for domain.com (see https://zeit.world for help) > [debug] #1 GET /domains/domain.com: 271.741ms > [debug] Found domain domain.com with verified:true > [debug] No records found for "domain.com" > Verification OK!

Fix now alias on new domains (#207) Bail if no records are found for a domain to allow adding the records. now alias derp domain.com -d > [debug] Checking for updates. > [debug] Up to date (1.0.0). > [debug] /list: 583.880ms > [debug] matched deployment derp by url derp.now.sh > domain.com is a custom domain. > Verifying the DNS settings for domain.com (see https://zeit.world for help) > [debug] #1 GET /domains/domain.com: 271.741ms > [debug] Found domain domain.com with verified:true > [debug] No records found for "domain.com" > Verification OK!
